title: How important is grammar in creative writing? - Quora

response.answer_text: How important is grammar in creative writing? If all you want to do is write for yourself. It doesn’t matter. If you want to write for others and potentially sell your work, then you simply have to do the study and practice. I am a programmer before I am a writer. When I was young… I sucked at English. I liked comic books and I genre fiction and got it in my head I wanted to write stories that turned out the way -I- wanted. I joined a pro-writing class at age 15, and barely scraped through with a ‘D’. The instructor took no mercy on me just because I was 5 to 10 years younger than her next youngest student. So, my stories and chapters came back bloody. I learned from my mistakes and I got better. Now, I help other writers. Like anything else it’s time and effort. Grammar is fundamental to writing. Meaning is critical to story. Bad fundamentals distract the reader. They say the writer doesn’t care enough to figure out the basics. That’s not a message that reflects well on you.

A2A… Good and correct grammar is very important in any form of writing. Grammar forms the basics of any language. Just like your basics in sciences must be clear, your basics (grammar) in any language must also be strong. It brings a smooth flow to your writing.It makes it easy and comfortable for the readers to read and understand.With good knowledge of grammar, you'll be able to write more conveniently.It helps you communicate your ideas better and more clearly with your readers.It always feels better to read something which is grammatically correct than something which isn't.Read and practice basic rules of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adverbs, adjectives, tenses, punctuations etc. Any basic grammar book or even the internet can help you with all these. Thank you for the question Sir Swadesh Chakrabarty. —Archita.
